thread.title: Booze On Demand: Amazon Prime to Deliver Alcohol
thread.title_full: Booze On Demand: Amazon Prime to Deliver Alcohol

author: Aaron Hankin
title: Booze On Demand: Amazon Prime to Deliver Alcohol

organizations.name: amazon prime to deliver alcohol amazon

text:
Amazon Prime Now to Deliver Alcohol (AMZN) By Aaron Hankin | March 15, 2017 â€” 1:37 PM EDT 
Online retail giant is lifting the spirits of Ohio residents. 
Amazon.com Inc ( AMZN ) announced Wednesday that it is adding alcohol to its one and two-hour Prime Now delivery service to residents in Cincinnati and Columbus, OH, just in time for March Madness . For $7.99 residents can order wine, champagne and a range of local (Rhinegeist and MadTree) and domestic beers making that trip through the snow for a cold one a little easier. (See also: Beeronomics: Factors Affecting Your Pint ) 
"Whether you run out of wine at your dinner party or need more chilled champagne for mimosas at a family brunch, Prime Now can save customers time with super fast delivery so they can skip a trip to the store," Stephenie Landry, VP of Prime Now worldwide said. 
Amazon said Prime Now members can enter their ZIP code to see if the service is available or set a notification when the service becomes available in their area or log into their primenow.com account for regular updates. 
Amazon already offers an array of alcohol-related products through its online service making the addition of alcohol the final mixture of the new Prime Now cocktail. (See also: Google Express vs. Amazon Prime Now ) 
"We are excited to continue expanding our product offerings, and we know customers will love getting wine and beer delivered right to their door in one hour or less."
